name: 華國媛
objective:
The course is designed to teach upper level undergraduate students and graduate students about the recent advances in protein science and glycobiology with specific application in medical and biotechnological industries. This course provides a comprehensive understanding of proteomics, emphasizing the revolutionary impact of AlphaFold on protein structure prediction. Students will explore proteomics techniques, data analysis, and practical applications, with hands-on experience using AlphaFold.

Course Goals includes:
1. Understand the principles of proteomics and protein biochemistry.
2. Gain proficiency in experimental and computational proteomics techniques.
3. Explore the functionalities and applications of AlphaFold in predicting protein structures.
4. Apply knowledge to real-world biological problems.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to Proteins and Proteomics- Nobel 2024
Week 2: Protein Biochemistry I
Week 3: Protein Biochemistry II
Week 4: Hierarchical structure of proteins I
Week 5: Hierarchical structure of proteins II
Week 6: Protein domains and motifs.
Week 7: Functional roles of proteins: Enzymes, transport, signaling, and structural proteins.
Week 8: Introduction to AlphaFold
Week 9: Midterm (30%)
Week 10: AlphaFold: History and development (key achievements) 
Week 11: Overview of machine learning in structural biology
Week 12: Limitations of AlphaFold
Week 13: Unix Basic, PDB database, Structural analysis tools
Week 14 Training data and methods I. 
Week 15: EMBL platform introduction
Week 16-17: Training data and methods II.
Week 18: Final exam (30%)
scorePolicy:
Evaluation:  Homework (20%), Mid-term (30 %), Final case report (30%), Class attendance (20 %)
